destroy()

Ensures that no more I/O activity happens on this socket. Only necessary in case of errors.

  • Session#destroy
Source:

Sends data on the socket.

Name Type Attributes Description
data String | Buffer The data to be sent.

 If the data is binary.
callback function <optional>
 The callback parameter will be executed when the data is finally written out.

setTimeout(timeout, callback) → {Session}

Sets the session to timeout after timeout milliseconds of inactivity on the session. By default Session do not have a timeout.
Parameters:
Name Type Description
timeout Number If timeout is 0, then the existing idle timeout is disabled.
callback function The callback parameter will be added as a one time listener for the 'timeout' event.
Inherited From:
  • Session#setTimeout
Source:
  • session.js, line 219
See:
  • https://nodejs.org/api/net.html#net_socket_settimeout_timeout_callback

this
